comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: A similar pic to this, taken by Sydney society photographer Harold Cazneaux, appeared in the August 1925 edition of the Home. The caption accompanying the Home pic doesn't exactly make it clear who's who, but it looks like one of the chaps in the vehicle closest the camera is Admiral Robinson...I'd say photographer Sam Hood must have been standing somewhere near Harold Cazneaux when he took this pic. One of the other Home pics, which shows the procession passing thru the welcome arch, might even include both Hood and Cazneaux...the snappers snapped! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/10151340396/] PS...if this chap below isn't from HMS Pinafore, my alternative theory is he's one of the Admirals who visited Sydney in 1925 with the US Fleet... [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8565922481/in/set-72157630107954130]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Nice one thanks QM! We're thinking though, if Cazneaux took the photos then that can't be him in the photo, although it might just be from his studio. Based on our experience with Hera Roberts, it looks like Hood may have done more work for the Home. I'd be interested to see what else pops up over time. If only they were digitised! :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] maybe Cazneaux took a selfie!

Where I hang out the library holding of the Home is very incomplete...in some years there are only a couple of issues...so my forays into it have been very hit and miss...the Home mainly involves hi-brow culture, so it's not a goldmine if you're interested in popular culture...it's full of beautiful pics though.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] haha, maybe :P Thanks for the tip regarding Home by the way :)
